item.summary: Master stuck in loop wanting to assign but regions are closing

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Tried to figure this one. We try to do the reassignment every 3 seconds which jibes with regionserver doing its regular report. The 10 is the maximum number of regions a hrs will volunteer in its message of most loaded. Why does the master think these are closing yet the regionserver keeps passing them in the message is odd. Around this time we had some hungup regionservers. Maybe the regions were closing but not yet closed on the HRS. Need to check. If so, then might make sense reintroducing a closing flag on regions and then do not return region if its already passed into closing state.

Will check these regions out on regionservers to verify this is indeed the case.

Digging in, I see where master sends to an HRS the close message because it judges the regionserver overloaded. I see the regionserver getting the close but then the close taking too long because of issues with hdfs (or deadlock in hdfs – looking at that next). Meantime the regionserver is sending over heartbeat with list of overloaded regions.

I could add a closing state and then if region is closing, this would mean that in the heartbeat we'd not send an already closing region. Probably no harm. Wouldn't fix the root cause. Eventually the regionserver will have no more regions for the master to close. Will still be stuck in the loop though if can't actually close regions.

Will add the closing state for this issue and then try and deal with the hangup in next issue.

Here is patch that adds closing state to Regions and then in the HRS, it doesn't offer regions that are closed or closing as part of the list of most loaded regions to the master for it to later try close.
